The number of buddha-lands equal to the particles of dust in the buddha-fields, in those lands, the buddhas and bodhisattvas surrounded by assemblies, all complete and pure, all heroic, with the eloquence of virtuous conduct and greatly adorned, with immeasurable enlightened adornments, like the bright illumination of the sun, adorned with various jewels.

And yet they manifest themselves in various places and expound the scriptures and Dharma, with unobstructed eyes that clearly understand everything, freely controlling the Dharma, standing out from the crowd;
with ears that discern, they attain the other shore;

Attains the ability to be gentle and yielding;

The bodhisattva attains mastery over this Dharma.

The bodhisattva, relying on this samÄdhi, in the east, at the sites of innumerable thousands of dust particles in ten buddha lands, establishes each name, and with each name, in those ten buddha lands, which are like dust particles, none can limit his recollection.
From that single particle, it is divided into countless buddha-lands, as numerous as particles, filling them all, yet without awareness, and without increase or decrease.
Just as in the case of a single non-awakening, without increase or decrease, it is the same throughout all lands, as numerous as particles.
As it is in the east, so it is in the south, west, north, the four intermediate directions, above and below.
The number of places where a single particle is broken and placed is also as above.
The bodhisattva is able to establish them all and manifest his body everywhere.
This is the bodhisattva's ability to purify and establish all buddha-lands.

and because he is inconceivable, he is able to move and cause universal manifestation.ğŸ”½The TathÄgata's ears proclaim immeasurable sounds;
the TathÄgata's nose distinguishes immeasurable smells;

The TathÄgata's right enlightenment and knowledge are also immeasurable.
Proclaiming the TathÄgata's pure voice.
Universally manifesting the TathÄgata's Dharma wheel without turning back.
Causing all to universally know the TathÄgata's holy assembly with immeasurable numbers.
The TathÄgata's Dharma enlightenment is also immeasurable and universally guiding.
Universally manifesting the TathÄgata's fundamental merits and virtues.
Manifesting entry into the TathÄgata's samÄdhi and the TathÄgata's virtues.
Cultivating in the three times, with immeasurable TathÄgatas manifesting and establishing all dharmas.
The TathÄgata's established proclamation of sound.
These are the ten.
Manifesting the establishment of the TathÄgata's land.
Using the Buddha's voice to universally rain down all dharmas.
Causing that sound to be universally heard in all lands.
Widely spreading and transmitting the Buddha's correct acceptance.
Also, universally proclaiming the World-Honored Buddhas and the assembly of sages.
Establishing the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddhas.
The Dharma that is proclaimed is all like an illusion.
Proclaiming the Dharma, yet without attachment.
Clearly manifesting all Dharma realms.
Universally manifesting the practices of the TathÄgata's virtues.
These are the ten.
All samÄdhis follow and guide like an illusion, establishing the mind like an illusion, understanding without obstruction.
The bodhisattva is sovereign over this Dharma realm, and is thus established as a bodhisattva.
Those Buddha World-Honored Ones!
In the various kinds of minds and thoughts, with each and every name, they manifest countless buddha lands, countless thousands of tathÄgatas as numerous as dust motes;
With each and every name, as numerous as dust motes;
Each particle is placed like ten buddha lands, up to nine times the number of particles in buddha lands, without increase or decrease.
There is no one who can know or grasp it, and this is what the bodhisattva establishes.
Cultivating the practice of non-attachment, which is also established by the mind.
Established by the intention of the practice of non-attachment.
Because there is no confusion regarding all dharmas, it is established by mindfulness;
Because the wisdom of all dharmas is distinguished, it is established by practice;
Because it is the place where all dharmas are received, it is established by practice;
Because it accords with and reveres all dharmas, it is also established by the path of enlightenment;

Because it cultivates and widely transmits the Dharma, it also establishes countless emotions.ğŸ”½Because it establishes spiritual powers and distinguishes the expedient wisdom used in the Dharma, it is the practice of non-arising.
Because it clearly establishes the Dharma realm without attachment, it also abides in the practice of entering wisdom.
Because immeasurable wisdom is pure, it also abides in the state of perfect enlightenment.
Because they manifest and move in all lands.
Because bodhisattvas abide in these samÄdhis, they attain the ten ocean-like gateways.
What are the ten?
First, it means filling the ocean of buddhas, because they follow and guide the ocean of dharmas.
Second, it means transcending the ocean of dharmas, because they have realized the ocean of wisdom.
Third, it means abiding in all luminous appearances, because they are unattached to sentient beings.
Fourth, it means inspiring with wisdom, because they spread their voices.
Fifth, it means contemplating the ocean of sentient beings' minds, because they follow with skillful wisdom.
Sixth, it means understanding the ocean of minds, because they know countless minds without various views.
Seventh, it means fulfilling the ocean of practices, because they are replete with vows.
Eighth, it means fulfilling the ocean of all practices and vows.
Tenth, it means accomplishing all the paths to enlightenment.
These are the ten.
is the bodhisattva's fulfillment of the ocean of all virtuous qualities.
Bodhisattvas have ten things by which they attain the highest honor.
What are the ten?
First, with the highest honor, they guide all.
Second, seeking the highest, they transform and guide sentient beings.
Third, seeking the highest honor, they then reach all pure practices.
Fourth, attaining the highest power, they seek and obtain it.
Fifth, seeking the unequaled, they are supreme in all worlds.
Sixth, seeking the unsurpassed, they conquer Mara.
Seventh, seeking to be illuminated, they liberate all from evil paths.
Eighth, seeking to rely on nothing, they are born in all places.
Ninth, they are honored in all Buddha-dharmas.
Tenth, seeking to be sovereign, they will be valiant among all beings.
These are the bodhisattvas' ten highest honored dharmas.
Bodhisattvas have ten more things that arise in the realm of sentient beings.
What are the ten?
First, always aspiring to leave the household life, in order to deliver sentient beings.
Second, being without turning back, due to the most powerful progress.
Third, seeking to rely on the buddhas, in order to practice the practices.
Fourth, having unlimited power, in order to progress in the teachings.
Fifth, the power of tranquil concentration, in order to be sovereign over the teachings.
Sixth, the mind being without turning back, due to the power of guiding in accordance with [sentient beings].
Seventh, being sovereign over meanings, due to the power of originally having no dharmas.
Eighth, being of great wisdom, due to the power of proclaiming the Dharma without obstruction.
Ninth, the power of valor, due to being established in the Dharma.
Tenth, the power of discrimination, due to proclaiming immeasurable wisdom.
These are the ten kinds of power.
And further, they attain ten great courageous powers.
What are the ten?
First, the power of being the most vigorous.
Second, the power of being unsurpassed.
Third, the power of being immeasurable.
Fourth, the power of good cultivation.
Fifth, the power of being unmoving.
Sixth, the power of being unarisen.
Seventh, the power of being free from anger.
Eighth, the power of always being wise.
Ninth, the power of diligently establishing.
Tenth, the power of vast compassion.
These are the ten powers.
There are also ten powers.
What are the ten?
First, the power of cultivating disciplined conduct.
Second, the power of the purity of wisdom.
Third, the power of the pure Dharma that transcends.
Fourth, the power of the Dharma body.
Fifth, the power of the realm of all dharmas.
Sixth, the power of the illumination of the Dharma.
Seventh, the power of the mind of the Dharma.
Eighth, the power of being indestructible.ğŸ”½Ninth, the power of cultivating good conduct.
Tenth, the power of diligently cultivating effort.
These are the ten powers.
There are also ten powers.
What are the ten?
First, the power of a great man.
Second, the power of upright valor.
Third, the power established by the Perfectly Enlightened One.
Fourth, the power of the roots of virtue cultivated in past lives.
Fifth, the power of immeasurable roots of virtue in accordance with the Dharma.
Sixth, the power of the TathÄgata.
Seventh, the power to respond universally.
Eighth, the power of equality in the three times.
Ninth, the power of the bodhisattvas' practice of the stages like the earth.
Tenth, the power of the bodhisattvas' practice of pure faith and understanding.
These are the ten powers.
There are also ten powers.
What are the ten powers?
First, the power of the bodhisattvas' detachment from change.
Second, the power of the bodhisattvas' conformity with conditions.
Third, the power of the bodhisattvas' mastery over their nature.
Fourth, the power of the bodhisattvas' cultivation of the purity of their inner nature.
Fifth, bodhisattvas cultivate the roots of virtue with the power of various practices.
Sixth, bodhisattvas practice the most powerful Dharma.
Seventh, the body is without attachment, with the power of non-attachment.
Eighth, bodhisattvas attain the power of accomplishment through this.
Ninth, bodhisattvas enter the power of skillful wisdom.
Tenth, bodhisattvas have the power of pure faith in the fundamental nature of all dharmas.
These are the ten.
There are also ten powers.
What are the ten?
First, abiding in the universal world, with the power of solitude and non-abiding.
Second, among all beings, with the power of being unmatched.
Third, universally among all, with the power of being unequaled.
Fourth, with the power of virtue and practice, transforming sentient beings.
Fifth, dwelling in birth and death, with the power of unwavering movement.
Sixth, crossing through birth and death, pure like a lotus flower, with the power of purity.
Seventh, universally manifesting all guides, subduing the power of Mara.
Eighth, in order to subdue the forces of MÄra and perfect the power of the Great Vehicle.
Ninth, in order to transform the three realms and attain the power of non-abiding.
Tenth, in order to universally encourage and progress the ten directions with unobstructed power.
These are the ten.
Bodhisattvas use these innumerable dharmas to perfect their virtuous transformations.
Moreover, when bodhisattvas give rise to the practice of fulfilling the wishes of the multitude, they illuminate and shine upon them, universally responding to them and accomplishing them all.
This leads to the vast increase in wisdom and the purification of benefits.
These are the ten pure concentrations.
Those virtues are boundless, and their wisdom is also unobstructed.
The bodhisattva practices are also immeasurable.
The virtue vehicle of those bodhisattvas surpasses measure and is difficult to describe.
Moreover, the place of those bodhisattva practices is difficult to measure, and the entry of those bodhisattvas is unfathomable.
The transformations that those bodhisattvas give rise to are also boundless.
The purity of the bodhisattvas is also difficult to imagine;ğŸ”½The cultivation of the bodhisattvas is also difficult to exhaust;

Because there is nothing to attain, there is also no limit to recollection.
What the bodhisattvas can attain, what the bodhisattvas can give rise to, what the bodhisattvas should manifest and practice, what the bodhisattvas should attain,
And the places to which the bodhisattvas' illumination reaches,
And what the bodhisattvas' penetrating insight sees,
And what the bodhisattvas' wisdom illuminates,
And what the bodhisattvas' Dharma practice knows and sees,
And what the bodhisattvas' practice should attain,
And the bodhisattvas' wisdom in all Dharma practices penetrates them all.
These are the ten.
Those who abide in this great concentration have innumerable, limitless, immeasurable, boundless, inexhaustible, immeasurable, inconceivable, and unobtainable attainments.

It is like the palace of the king of the Anavatapta Lake, from which four great rivers flow out, full and clear, without impurities, turbidity, or defilements, pure and flawless, sweet-smelling and fragrant.
Surrounding it in four directions, there are four eyes and mouths, from which flow:
One eye is named Harmony.
Two eyes are named Extraction.
Three eyes are named Snake-like.
Four eyes are named Constant.
The Harmony flows north, the Extraction flows south.
The Snake flows east, the Constant flows west.
Each one circles around, and it is the same in the four directions, filling it up and making it full.

Between these rivers, there are blue lotus flowers, red lotus flowers, white lotus flowers, and yellow lotus flowers, with the light and color of the heavenly treasures, pure and bright, shining upon each other, fresh and clean, forever free from defilement, clearly illuminating in between, shining and penetrating.
The leaves are divided differently, shining brightly, not painted by a painter.

The color of the wisdom is difficult to depict to the utmost, with countless heavenly verses and patterns, universally practiced with joy.

These flowers are lowered up and down, with a wonderful color shining brightly, illuminating the jeweled colors.
The curved sunlight shines, and the dark yellow is then blocked. The brilliance of the sunlight is like the movement of those flowers, and the sound of the flowing river surpasses heavenly music.
The Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is also like this!
There are four unobstructed eloquences flowing out, filling the ocean of universal wisdom.
Like the great river of incense, with a wonderful color of silver, flowing out from the horse's mouth.
The bottom is all of silver sand.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
The pure wisdom, in accordance with various practices, flows out from the mouth, in accordance with the meaning.

All the practices of the TathÄgatas, all the practices of meanings, the Dharma of skillful giving, the wisdom of all dharmas, the unobstructed wisdom of thorough understanding and discernment, return to the ocean of wisdom;
Like the great river of harmony, with the color of vajra, flowing out from the lion's mouth, the sand at the bottom is also the color of vajra.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
Emitting the light of the Dharma, with the color of the Buddha's vajra, enjoying oneself, illuminating the entire world.
With the wisdom of vajra, enjoying oneself, filling the inexhaustible ocean.
Just like those two great rivers, with purple-gold color, bright and shining, also with purple-gold-colored sand.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
Using the eloquence of sending forth, it comes out from the mouth, all beings yearn for the wisdom body, and delight the entire world;
Using the wisdom of vajra, it illuminates.
Universally liberating all, always yearning to follow and guide causes and conditions, causing them to return to the ocean of wisdom;
Also like the great river VÄlukÄ, blue and the color of lapis lazuli, flowing out from the mouth of an ox, with the pure color of pure flowing water.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
Using inexhaustible bright and shining eloquence to flow out;
Using the Dharma without obstruction, with the majestic power of billions of nayutas of hundreds of thousands.
Raining from thought, flowing and progressing to the river of Dharma, filling the ocean of universal wisdom, accomplishing the ocean of the Buddha's Dharma treasury;
Just as the four sides of the river flow around and return to fill the great ocean.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
They follow the turning of physical actions, follow the turning of mental actions, and with the turning of body, speech, and mind, they are all fully equipped.
It is also like the four rivers flowing into the ocean.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
With the four adornments, they return to the ocean of universal wisdom.
What are the four?
First, seeing the buddhas is an adornment.
Second, seeing the Buddha's discerning wisdom.
Third, the radiance of the Buddha's teachings is an adornment.
Fourth, grasping the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s without doubt.

First, the perfections are an adornment.
Second, the bodhisattvas are an adornment of practice.
Third, the practice of great compassion is an adornment.
Fourth, it is adorned with the practice of fulfilling the Dharma wheel for all sentient beings.

Just as the great river circles seven times, adorned with four flowers - blue, red, yellow, and white.
The bodhisattva is also like this!
With the mind of the Great Vehicle, in between, he expounds the Dharma for those who have not yet been liberated, causing them to arise.
He distributes the samadhis and samÄpattis, billions and trillions of them.
Universally seeing the virtues of the Buddha, in the three times, in the buddha-lands, practicing purely without defilement, like that which arises without stillness, surrounded by jeweled trees.

Adorned with the adornments of the lands, he attains perfect enlightenment and manifests joy.
Just as that water pool is still and unmoving, yet clear and transparent.
The bodhisattva is also like this!
That bodhisattva governs the mind with the Way and virtue, tranquil and clear, replete with countless roots of virtue.
Like that Anavatapta Pond, with precious treasures as its banks, shining through and through, pure and spotless.
The bodhisattva is also like this!

That bodhisattva mind, with ten precious wisdoms, reaching billions of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of practices, attaining the supreme vow wisdom, and fully obtaining the clear and pure roots of virtue.
Like that Anavatapta, clear and transparent inside and out, with purple gold sand on the bottom, adorned with various treasures.
The bodhisattva is also like this!

Attaining penetrating wisdom, with a mind free from thought, illuminating the realm of the bodhisattvas, adorning oneself with the virtues and practices of the bodhisattvas, unobstructed in all dharmas, with the practices of all buddhas having no location, knowing all practices and clearly understanding the time.
Like that Anavatapta inhabited by various dragons.
The bodhisattva is also like this!
In accordance with guiding all fearful worlds, it is also completely manifested, universally protecting the extreme world.
Just as that flowing water emerges from the four eyes and flows forward, returning to the Buddha's virtues, gradually flowing to the ferry, returning to the ocean.

Using the flowing waters of the four kinds of wisdom, for the realms of devas, brahma, and demons, the world's Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as, and the extreme world's human race, they universally moisten them, gradually flowing to the ferry and returning to the Buddha's unsurpassed wisdom ocean, adorning themselves with the four kinds of power.

Fourth, it illuminates the basis of all sentient beings, illuminates all thoughts, causes them to return to the stream of non-cessation, and attains the wisdom of the ocean of the three times.

Eliminating dwelling places refers to the practice of concentration and wisdom of the bodhisattva.
Using innumerable concentrations as the adornment of various treasures, one beholds the buddhas;
Using the wisdom of non-seeing, one returns to the ocean of the buddhas;
Using the practice of the wisdom of great compassion, one's practice also has great kindness, guiding all without turning back, and one's aspirations are lofty;
Using innumerable skillful wisdoms, one returns to the ocean of the ten powers.
Just as the four rivers emerge from the Anavatapta Pond and return to the great ocean without end,

Practicing the great vows at the beginning, perfecting the practices of the bodhisattvas, attaining the inexhaustible great wisdom of all, and the practices are also inexhaustible, always beholding the buddhas as entertainment.
Just as those four great rivers, without turning back, flow into the great ocean, without destruction or interruption.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
The vows of bodhisattvas are unobstructed, and they attain the radiance of cultivating the practices and vows of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva in their entirety;
They attain entry into the practices of universal wisdom, the path of practice of the enlightened ones, and cultivate the practices of the TathÄgata without thought or attachment.
Just as those four great rivers, without slackening or stopping for eons, flow into the ocean.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!

Cultivating entry into the practices of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, for countless eons they cultivate bodhisattva practices without slackening, and attain the return to the ocean of all tathÄgatas, returning to the practice of non-conceptuality.
Just as that great river without turning back is illuminated by various treasures;ğŸ”½It is illuminated by purple gold sand;ğŸ”½It is radiant with silver sand;
It is shining with gold sand;
The ground is made of lapis lazuli sand, shining brightly, outshining the sun's radiance. When the sun shines, its light penetrates through the sun, and nothing is disturbed by it.
That radiance is incomparable, and the various treasures are used to make it.
The bodhisattvas are also like this!

They attain freedom in the Dharma body, establish themselves in concentration, and from each pore of their bodies, they emit the boundless light of all buddhas, see all lands, and understand entering the assembly;
They hear the Dharma, are able to uphold it all, understand the TathÄgata's countless bodily practices, and clearly understand those buddha lands.
Seeing the TathÄgata's assembly, hearing his Dharma teachings, attaining non-attainment, eliminating the long-standing thoughts of billions of kalpas,
And having no short-term thoughts, the number of hairs on their bodies also does not decrease.
And the assemblies of TathÄgatas in all lands, without dwelling in discrimination in various realms of beings.
Why is it so?
Because of entering the Dharma realm and understanding the subtlety of non-self.
Also, without entering into destruction, practicing innumerable concentrations and cultivating innumerable practices.
Universally manifesting in the presence of all Buddhas, established by innumerable Buddhas, moved by innumerable Buddhas, universally returning to the practice and vows of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva.
With the pure practice of bodhisattvas, the ten powers of the TathÄgata, without obstruction.
Cultivating the practice of Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, establishing and fulfilling, understanding all movements, without obstruction.
Bodhisattvas are like this!

With a single thought, they attain enlightenment, manifesting their extreme length, not falling into the practice of entering, not attached to all practices, being apart from existence and nonexistence, only manifesting the arising of Buddha lands for the sake of all.

In the Dharma realm, they do not see any place or location, nor do they abide within limits or between two extremes. They cultivate and enter into the wisdom of universal knowledge, delighting in abiding in wisdom without self-importance, and understand how to enter the various types of sentient beings;

They do not cease giving rise to thoughts, but completely transcend the various forms and appearances, fully understanding without defilement.
The skillful means and wisdom of the bodhisattvas are fully perfected, reaching permanent purity, completely free from thoughts, and universally establishing the stages of practice.
It is like space, free from all destinations, forever without any destination.
The bodhisattvas' practice in the lands is also like this!
Fully understanding all lands, they cultivate practice to liberate sentient beings, forever free from all thoughts of sentient beings.

Understanding all dharma realms, eliminating all dharma thoughts, seeing buddhas without weariness, relying on the desire to behold buddhas, comprehending all samÄdhis, discerning skillful means, all dharmas originally pure, and without attachment.

The wisdom of inexhaustible dharma phrases, immeasurable eloquence, understanding wordlessness and signlessness, attaining all sounds and practices, understanding the purity of sounds, reaching the limit of the unobtainable dharma, manifesting various forms.
In accord with the realm of guidance, all dharmas originally pure, ultimately with great compassion, liberating the realms of all sentient beings.
Without cause, without basis, all realms originally pure, understanding the abiding dharma realm without arising;
Understanding all destinies without abiding, the three realms originally pure.

Understanding the practice of the TathÄgata, in various dharmas without thought, skillfully practicing various eloquent explanations, purely proclaiming the Dharma, attaining the practice of the Dharma.
This son of a great clan!
The great being!
In the Dharma realm, he attains adornment and great respect.
Chapter 12: The Great Skillful Wisdom of Bodhisattva Samantabhadra What is meant by the tenth great virtue and skillful wisdom practice of the great beings, the bodhisattvas, son of a great clan?
This son of a great clan!
The bodhisattvas have a great concentration called the Inexhaustible Field.
Those who abide in this concentration attain the inexhaustible practice of body, speech, and mind;
Equally abide in the inexhaustible buddha-lands;
